Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2011 02:39PM fofire991 wrote: They did not give me any info except to immediately send me for an ultrasound. I have a dr appt tomorrow with my PCP. I also just had a pea shaped hard lump come up under the opposite armpit. Its very painful and making my whole arm ache. Increasing aching in my shoulder blade. I am due to have my re-check on my mammogram the end of the month. I am hoping they will go ahead and schedule it to make sure the symptoms are not from what they thought was benign before.
Posts.Title: Abnormal Mammogram Normal Ultrasound fofire991 nlm

Posts.Content: fofire991 wrote: I am 49 years old, had my annual mammogram and it came back abnormal. Had to go in for a diagnostic mammogram and then had an ultrasound. They advised they believed I had ligaments twisted in an odd formation and sent me home. I then received a letter stating to make sure their diagnosis is confirmed I need a follow up mammogram six months later. Its now been 5 months and I am experiencing pain in that breast along with pain in shoulder, shoulder blade and armpit all on same side. Should I be concerned? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Abnormal Mammogram Normal Ultrasound fofire991 nlm
